title: FACT CHECK: Will banks block accounts of those not having ‘NPR document’? - Times of India
subtitle: News News: A photo of what looks like a notice is doing rounds on social media platform Facebook with a claim that from April 1, 2020, banks will seek documents
author: timesofindia.indiatimes.com
vclaim: A photo of what looks like a notice is doing rounds on social media platform Facebook with a claim that from April 1, 2020, banks will seek documents from the National Population Register NPR ) and those not in possession of these documents will have their accounts blocked.The photo that is being widely shared advises depositors to withdraw all their money from banks before March 31, 2020.The notice is fake. No such directive has been issued by the Reserve Bank of India (the only authority authorized to issue such notifications) saying ‘NPR document’ would be necessary for operating bank accounts.The Press Information Bureau ( PIB ) tweeted from its verified handle rubbishing the notice and describing it fake.Posting the same notice with a red cross mark on it, PIB wrote, “The claim of banks blocking accounts of those depositors not possessing NPR documents is false. No such communication has been issued by the RBI.”We then looked through the official website of the RBI and found no such notification or press release, wherein ‘NPR document’ possession has been made mandatory for having a bank account.Times Fact Check has found the notification claiming ‘NPR document’ will be mandatory for operating bank accounts to be fake.
